diff_analysis.evidence: In Think/Route.class.php the OLD code’s invoke() and invokeRegx()/invokeRule() paths allow arbitrary route callbacks (Closures) to be executed based on URL patterns without additional restriction. Combined with the broader framework behavior (e.g., load_ext_file and dynamic inclusion/eval in View::fetch), this increases the attack surface for code injection if an attacker can influence route configuration or uploaded extension files. The NEW code tightens routing and removes some dynamic behaviors; reverting to the OLD routing logic reintroduces a higher risk of code injection (CWE-94).
